author: parithosh
content:
So if i get this right:
- You already have a script that does failover
- You want your EL/CL to advertise their IP based on which uplink is active? 

Shouldn't this happen automatically once you port forward on your router?

author: pk910
content:
Not exactly.
I have a failover script, but that script only switches from one link to the other (and backwards), it does not use both links concurrently. 
So if the active link dies, all connected peers to my CL/EL are dead too. 
It will then reconnect them via the second link after failover, but there is still a gap that could cause a missed attestation/proposal/etc.

I'd like the EL/CL to advertise both external IPs, so I get incoming connections on both links. So in case one of the links dies there are still enough peers connected via the second link.
I think I'll try it with routing outgoing connections only and use only one of the links for incoming connections for now.
Let's see how this works...
